title: Is Chaos the Antidote to Chaos? How the Reality behind the Bronze Serpent Rewrites the Code.
description:
We dissect Maps of Meaning, pp. 140 to 141 and look at the symbolism of truth, reality, meaning, chaos, the ground of being.

Animation of the Hopf Vibration:  https://youtu.be/AKotMPGFJYk

Myth of the pelican feeding her offspring with her own blood
http://www.thewestologist.com/symbols/the-symbol-of-self-sacrifice

If He be lifted up:
https://youtu.be/A5htobGcfGI

Godel, Escher, Bach by Douglas Hofstadter
C. S. Lewis' Great War with Barfield by Adley

A limit to self-deception.
Humility and Gratitude
Loops and Cycles. Daily Cycles, Weekly, Yearly, constructing our lives.
The end is a new beginning.
Spirit as a distillation of matter (the spirit of the Father reveals itself over a long period of history as a distillation of what we have explored. 

Bacterial phage, the virus that keeps bacteria in check.
Viruses hijack the replicating mechanism of the cell and overwhelm the system.

The bronze serpent was raised up so that whoever looked upon it rather than looking upon the serpents would be healed. Later, the bronze serpent was worshipped as an idol until King Hezekiah had it cast down.
